website_summaries.verdict: Built for daily use as well as regular day-to-day activities.
pros: Can improve your flexibility as well as confidence during routine activities that may require extra effort due to injury
A great way to improve balance if you work at a standing desk as well
cons: Great for balance-related exercises but not high-impact ones

customer_reviews.title: This Works
customer_reviews.text: After a hospital stay my 92 year old mother needed balance and endurance therapy. The balance beam although hard work for her, has helped a lot. This is worthwhile, I made it a rule she had to use it everyday. I set it up in the hallway and she walked sideways down and back, then rested and walked toe to heel down and back and then rested. Every week she improved, after 6 to 8 weeks she could do the whole routine and only needed to rest at the end of it and was walking around the house with her cane. There were other exercises we did everyday, but I felt this made the most difference.
customer_reviews.author: Snickelfritz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent balance pad
customer_reviews.text: I had used this balancing pad in physical therapy, and decided to purchase one for use in my home exercise program after completing PT. It was a fine choice! -- large enough to use two-footed (I can even use it diagonally for a tandem stand, one foot directly in front of the other), and compact enough to store easily. I've also used it as a kneeling pad when cleaning the floor. I got my money's worth!
customer_reviews.author: Question Lady

customer_reviews.title: Amazing to build balance
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to increase bone density. When I used it for the first time, I was amazed at how well it helped me to stand on one leg for 1 minute and 30 seconds. Yes, I wobbled, but didn't break the stand. The cost is higher than other cushions I perused, but I'm glad I took the deep dive. Worth every penny and will most assuredly increase my bone density. I feel much stronger and it's weird, but when I walk, my feet are well positioned on the ground ( I never noticed what my feet were doing before Airex. Great investment in my health!
customer_reviews.author: Fabnikita

customer_reviews.title: Godsend for my standing desk
customer_reviews.text: I've been a standing desk user for ~ 2 years. I always prefer standing but my feet used to get really sore, even when using an anti-fatigue mat. I also hate wearing shoes all the time and have a liberal workplace where socks / bare feet are acceptable. In all my two years, this has been my best purchase yet. No more sore feet and I'm also more active being able to comfortably shift my weight around to different stances not possible on a flat floor. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive yes, but in this case, you get what you paid for...
customer_reviews.text: As a physical therapist, there really is no substitute for an Airex Pad. I originally ordered one of the many cheaper, generic foam pads thinking I'd save a few bucks, only to be royally disappointed in the actual quality/"feel" of the pad...it's just not the same. That being said, for some, I would imagine that it wouldn't matter too much, but for myself, having worked with an official airex for so many years, it's hard to accept something that seems to pale in comparison (e.g. feel, movement, pliancy, etc.) to the real deal. At the end of the day this is just one of those products that I feel you sorta just get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime C.

customer_reviews.title: Save time with this Airex product
customer_reviews.text: The same one as in the PT room. This Airex product I bought because the therapy place room used it with me. I made sure that Airex was the listed p product. It came in an Airex box. No smell at all, as other reviewers mentioned when they received their order. I use it not just for balance, but for sitting as well. It helped by sitting on it to maintain the 90deg hip precaution. After a year of trying other products and spending more money over the course of that time, then returning them, the price is well worth it. Save time, just spend the extra money up front for this - and finally - useful mat.
customer_reviews.author: Jvpdriven

customer_reviews.title: Could Be Better, Honestly
customer_reviews.text: I love these, I really do. They're almost necessary for proprioceptive exercises in a PT clinic. But they crack so easily after heavy use in a busy clinic.We have deep, deep ravines in ours and it doesn't seem like we've had it long enough for that to be the case. For something so expensive for what it is, sure seems like it could be done better.
customer_reviews.author: Colter S.

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent! Highly Recommended Pad!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was in doubt between this and a couple of other, less expensive brands. Finally decided to order the Airex one due to the different positive comments found here. I am so glad I did. This is the best Balance Pad I've seen. It was a great investment and I am sure it will last longer than other brands. Totally satisfied. Highly Recommended product!!!
customer_reviews.author: DMRI

customer_reviews.title: Great balance pad from Switzerland
customer_reviews.text: This balance pad is great for rehabilitation. It's the same my physical therapists use at the gym and have helped me tremendously. The only complaints that I have is that the one I received didn't look new and took forever to get to my house. The box was a little bit damaged as well. But since I didn't want to wait to ship it back and receive another one, I just kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Robe

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased :)
customer_reviews.text: I needed a mat to complete physical therapy exercises at home. After reading endless reviews on other products, I would COMPLETELY recommend this product to anyone and everyone. It is lightweight, yet just the right amount of give for balancing exercises or squats, etc. for physical therapy. Resistance to the pad is good and the pad is not cheap or flimsy. I would recommend spending a little extra money and purchasing this high quality product that will last for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: babiedol

customer_reviews.title: stability training
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pad for years at the gym and with my trainer. It's so good that I decided to purchase one for home. I would recommend using this pad near a counter or wall in case you fall. It's a marvelous training tool for balance. Going further into training, you can work muscle control as you are balancing. You can also add movement of the free leg and/or arms. It's very good for developing ankle strength.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Knee Pads
customer_reviews.text: Originally for physical therapy if I got that right, but these Airex pads go beyond that. When something falls under the bed at home or a hard-to-reach area needs a fix, we reach for these pads for our knees and elbows. Expensive, yes. Handsome and super-functional, yes. There's none better and they'll last for eons. Your knees will thank you! PS The thick Airex yoga mats are a boon for anyone with arthritis or achy anything. I've had mine for about 20 years and it still works perfectly and looks new.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I need this
customer_reviews.text: I have this in front of my bed. I need this to step on before I step on the hard floor after getting out of bed. I don't recommend this for everyone. If you have good balance, but a bad back, knees or painful feet, stepping on this before the floor when getting out of bed before gravity brings everything down to your feet will mean a world of difference to that first and second step towards the bathroom. I'm getting the longer version next.
customer_reviews.author: LahxLah

customer_reviews.title: Very glad I purchased this
customer_reviews.text: I recently did a 2 week period of physical therapy to help strengthen an ankle that was giving me some stability issues. Physical trainer happened to use an Airex Balance Pad with me and I could immediately see its high quality and the benefits it would provide me to have my own pad to use at home. Ordered through Amazon, received the real thing, works great. Worth every penny. Ankle now feels great and I will continue to use the Airex Balance Pad on a regular basis to prevent future ankle problems.
customer_reviews.author: BillZ

customer_reviews.title: The same as used in my physical therapy office
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these in physical therapy and wanted to continue with the workouts at home so I bought this pad. It is a bit expensive, but does seem to be the quality that I used in the physical therapy office. It comes in a nice box that has additional exercises and stretches that can be done using this pad. I have used it for about a month now and it seems to be holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Mmccartney

customer_reviews.title: May be too long and big for smaller people.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for doing hip thrusts, but was disappointed to find that it was too stiff and large for me to use for this purpose. I purchased this after viewing hip thrust videos, seeing the exercisers using this pad to protect themselves from the heavy barbell (Bret Contreras also recommends this). Unfortunately, as a 5'4" 120 pound petite female, this pad is too long and awkward to use for that purpose. It would also be too awkward for use on my shoulders during traditional barbell work. I will use it for floor work, as it is impressively padded, but I will have to come up with an alternative for hip thrusts.
customer_reviews.author: JulieIL

customer_reviews.title: Balance is crucially important, particularly as one ages!
customer_reviews.text: After a balance problem, I chose this item to help me work out at home for longer periods of time, like 30 mins while watching TV. It has been great. The pad is rather firm, so it will likely last for years and years. It is sturdy, and it compares favorably with the one at the cardiac center at the Y. Appears to be professional equipment. There you have it: I am happy!
customer_reviews.author: Lynchburg Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for physical therapy, balance and stability exercies
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent pad when working out to build leg strength, stability and balance. After a leg injury I was advised by my PT to work on regaining stability and balance by standing on one leg for 30 seconds and then alternating. The Airex pad helped tremendously with these exercises. I also use the pad for exercises and yoga positions requiring kneeling. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: c corley

customer_reviews.title: Must-have tool for balance exercises
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a total life saver for me and should be standard equipment in every household. DOing your balance exercises in the cushion will multiply the effect your get out of the exercise. The cushion helps you strengthen your ankle, knie and hip - love it. It does not come with a booklet of exercises, but if you get one lesson PT and they show you how to do the exercises right - you can train yourself for a weeks on this cushion, which will pay for it in no time by saving you the co-pay.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Liked this so much I bought more of them.
customer_reviews.text: So cool. I am using this as a seat pad to get myself into a better sitting posture. As a guy that is 6' 6" tall, chairs just are not built for me. A skilled Physical Therapist recommended getting this pad to elevate my sitting position. What a huge difference from a little thing. Top quality workmanship and good materials. Very happy with this, So happy I bought more for other chairs!
customer_reviews.author: R. Jimerson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Me Balanced
customer_reviews.text: After being diagnosed with Parkinson's disease I noticed some disturbing balance issues. Physical Therapy did wonders and the Airex Balance Pad Blue played a big part and is part of my regular in house PT routine. It's an ongoing challenge offering a less than solid base. Makes a difference in my confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Xcaliber

customer_reviews.title: Airex REGULAR Balance Pad
customer_reviews.text: My therapist advised me to get one for home use, since I have been using it in my therapy sessions. I was amazed at how much harder it is to do balance excercises on this, and the results from using this, versus balance excercises being done on a pillow or floor. This surface is much more challenging, and gives you a more thorough workout , strengthening all of your leg muscles and your balance skills at the same time. I highly reccomend this product!
customer_reviews.author: C. Ubell

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived with the box tabs that should be tucked in pulled out with nothing protecting the actual product. As for the product I received I had ordered the Kiwi green and received a pink one which I’m not a fan of, and to top it all off it looked like it may possibly been returned or used prior.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous...

customer_reviews.title: Great for balance and good price.
customer_reviews.text: This balance bad works well for standing balance ex but you can also kneel on it to protect your knees if doing quadraped exercises or tall-kneeling exercises or half-kneeling exercises. It is well made and it still going strong for me. Easy to keep clean too.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: GARDENING!!!!! Would die without this now!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for kneeling and sitting while I garden for many hours a day. It is beyond fabulous!! I also use it to sit on inside. Cleans easily. Virtually indestructible. So glad I found it. Actually found it on a physical therapy website for balance. But it is super comfy for gardening!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product, a lifesaver for bad knees
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Airex Balance Pad because I have to do a lot of stretching and strengthening exercises to keep my geezerly body limber. I also have cranky knees--which means a lot of floor contact is hard on the bones. This product is high quality and equally firm throughout. Enough cushion to be easy on your joints, but firm enough to keep you from destabilizing on the pad. Also great to use in conjunction with some foam rolling exercises where you need support for your head. Also great if you like to kneel for prayer! I've only had mine a month but with proper care, it should last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for work out and meditation
customer_reviews.text: I used it all the time at the gym to do planks, side planks and stability training (weight lifting while standing on it). As it is so useful, I bought one for my husband to use at home. Once having it at home, I discovered another great use for the pad. I use it as a seat cushion when I meditate. Because it is firm, it doesn't sink in like pillows and gives my hip great support. I can sit longer and feel less discomfort on it than sitting on the floor. The pad is very dense and is made of quality material. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: FFDR

customer_reviews.title: Soooo happy with this cushion
customer_reviews.text: Soooo happy with this cushion. Fractured my left knee a year ago so while I've been fortunate to regain all my mobility, kneeling down on surfaces is still extremely difficult. Gym personnel recommended this and I couldn't believe the difference it made, like floating on pillows and zero pressure. It's wonderful around the house and my kitties can no longer hide under the bed from vet appointments. I also use this in my yoga classes. If you have had a knee injury, I highly recommend this. And it's a well-made product; the one at my gym was pretty beat-up but cushion was still effective.
customer_reviews.author: Maxie02

customer_reviews.title: I bought this after seeing it at my local physical ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing it at my local physical therapist's office. I had an old ankle injury that would occasionally cause discomfort. After a month of doing one legged balance stands on this, it has stopped bothering me.
customer_reviews.author: Caesar

customer_reviews.title: Helps rising from low chairs!
customer_reviews.text: I use the pad to help me get up from chairs that are without arms. A physical therapist showed me this trick and told me to order from Amazon which I did! I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: This is one of those circumstances where it is well worth the little bit of extra cost as you will have a great product that wil
customer_reviews.text: If you need a balance pad for exercises I implore you to get an Airex. There are cheaper brands out there, I have tried them and they just can not compare to the quality and durability of airex. This is one of those circumstances where it is well worth the little bit of extra cost as you will have a great product that will last you for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B

customer_reviews.title: Must have for floor exercises, lunges, etc.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great multi-purpose piece of equipment for working out at the gym or home. They have these at the gym and I bought one to do the same exercises at home. An example is lunges. Keep it under your knee to prevent it from hitting the floor. Also, when I am on a mat (similar to yoga mat but thicker), I use it to support my neck for back exercises since I have cervical spine issues. It makes a nice pillow/support, without getting my back or body out of alignment. This is also great for planking exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Great for plank!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! It's well made and is great for several exercises. Not only is it great as padding for the bar for hip thrusts but also for plank exercises. I use it to cushion my forearms and elbows for plank.
customer_reviews.author: Madame X

customer_reviews.title: Professional pad, works great for my knees during mat exercises!
customer_reviews.text: Quality professionally Swiss-made pad. Does not have that strong odor that a previous pad had made in China. Will use for floor exercises on my Airex mat, and to save my knees on certain exercises. Really like it and happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MsResearchQueen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Worth the steep price. Have had mine for several years and still looks brand new. Take shoes off and it will wear less and your ankles will benefit from having to stabilize more. Be good to your ankles, knees and hips, buy one of these!
customer_reviews.author: steve j. graver

customer_reviews.title: Workout comfort
customer_reviews.text: I use daily basis Airex pad for sit-up, reclining bicycle, one leg stance, and physical therapy homework at home. I am 6'2" 270 lbs. Airex helps me have a stronger core while my back is comfortable and supported.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Knight

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I use mine in my office chair. I have had back surgery and sitting on my chair for long periods caused a lot of pain. I can tell a huge difference after sitting on this pad. I would buy it again in a second. It was recommended by my Physical Therapist.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stability pad
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best quality pad - whether for stability or for cushioning your knee for gym exercises or doing hip thrusts. It doesn’t crack and really lasts. Excellent
customer_reviews.author: almostfrench0612

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!!!
customer_reviews.text: This balance pad is not only good to stand on it’s excellent to sit on as well. I bought it for my mom post hip surgery and she used it to sit on. One year later she still uses it. It’s great!!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy pad for balance exercises
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to do balance exercise. I have labrynthitis and this pad helps me do my exercises which I have to do for the rest of my life now. Although I am 66, I have no problem using this pad. It is wide enough for my size eight feet to use without touching the edges of the pad. It is very thick. I weigh 123 lbs and stand 5'2" and this pad handles my weight with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: ElaineL

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 2 years then the foam began cracking and once it started it just kept cracking. Only one side was non-slip so couldn't just turn it over for continued use
customer_reviews.author: susan white

customer_reviews.title: Balance Plus
customer_reviews.text: After waking up with a stroke in Jan. 2012, after leaving the hospital, I founds my balance to be really shaky. I set out to find a product that would challenge me and improve my condition. This was my choice! Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Veditz

customer_reviews.title: Good.  Same as my PT uses.
customer_reviews.text: This is the same balance pad my Physical Therapist uses. Softer and squishier than some of the firmer pads so its more challenging - harder to keep your balance so theoretically better to improve stability issues. I tried one of the other cheaper ($30-ish) pads available on Amazon, but they were a firmer foam, so to simply keep it "pro", I returned it and went this one.
customer_reviews.author: FritzB.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: My husband used this exact item during his stay at a rehab hospital. Used every day while there and continues to use his own now that he's home
customer_reviews.author: Carol P

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but returned it for larger size
customer_reviews.text: Great mat but was not wide enough for me to do squats on comfortably, exchanged it with wider version and I love it! REALLY works your stabilizer muscles!
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up for the Airex Balance Pad
customer_reviews.text: I restore very large murals and I am often forced to kneel for very lengthy periods of time so as to reach the areas that need to be restored. The Airex Balance Pad has served me well. I have tried garden kneeling pads and gel filled protective knee cushions that I Velcro on, but the Airex seems to be the most comfortable solution. I really like the thickness of the pad and the dimensions give me plenty of room to shift weight if I need to while working. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who is doing their best to take care of their knees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Expensive, and Works
customer_reviews.text: Not sure you cannot find a good square of dense foam in some supply store, but this is the same one used at my hospital physical therapy department - EXCEPT their pad has raised "dots" on the bottom side...this one is smooth on both sides. I usemine on a rig, but the one's with "dots" may grip better on a smooth surface, like flooring.
customer_reviews.author: Yukon Jack

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worthwhile for big and tall folks
customer_reviews.text: For the broad shouldered, extra wide pad supports hands, elbows, knees, or feet when you need the extra cushioning for PT exercises. Turn it lengthwise and I can get hands and knees supported without using two pads that try to fly apart. The surface texturing actually does make a huge difference for anti-slip purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Lu

customer_reviews.title: Great Product I’ll Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom so she could sit better in low chairs after her knee surgery. This definitely does the job and made a big difference in managing her pain when sitting and standing during recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Moore

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for balance work
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! I wasn't sure what I wanted but this is perfect. I will probably order the large one also. I use for balance but also to to interval training for lower impact jogging. Makes it easier on my knees.
customer_reviews.author: kansas reader

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be good for just about anyone to increase muscle tone
customer_reviews.text: My wife purchased this to help with balancing problems. She has spine problems. It seems to be good for just about anyone to increase muscle tone. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Tippi

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: Recommended to me by the physical therapist I see. It clearly helps my balance at 75 years of age.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great Balance Pad
customer_reviews.text: After physical therapy I have used this giam pad to continue to strengthen my knee muscles. It is helping with balance too.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: A physical therapist recommended this balance pad for my PT routine and to help maintain and imoroce my balance. The quality is great and I can definitely feel an improvement to my balance and flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: NovaKay

customer_reviews.title: I selected this one because the box pictured in the ad looks exactly like the one from the pad I use at work
customer_reviews.text: False advertising. The pad measurements are not 20" x 16", but rather 18.6" x 15.2". I am beginning to wonder if this is an actual Airex product, or the same product as what I thought I had ordered. I selected this one because the box pictured in the ad looks exactly like the one from the pad I use at work. However the box that I received has a different design and the pad is clearly smaller than the one I have at work. The ad also indicates 'by Airex', which impacted my decision to select this one, but I later noticed that it was fulfilled by a different vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name Required

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful product. Just what I wanted to help will ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful product. Just what I wanted to help will balance and strengthening. Recommended by my therapist if I was wanting a balance pad and I do agree. This should last a very long time into my old age to keep me working!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Go with Airex
customer_reviews.text: I think Airex makes great quality items. I own one for hip thrusting as the other types of bar padding do not protect me. With this pad I no longer get bruises. I ordered a second one as a gift for a friend with a bad ankle to use for physical therapy and he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I had knee replacement and my PT suggested I get this to help me kneel when I garden. It is an expensive gardening pad, but if it helps me garden, I say it is worth it. I can kneel on it without too much discomfort but the knee is not healed enough to kneel for long periods of time yet.
customer_reviews.author: K. Adams

customer_reviews.title: For rehab with vestibular nerve dizziness
customer_reviews.text: For rehab with vestibular nerve dizziness. I really feel secure with it & the safety instructions given by my therapist & seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: Snooz

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pad but durability concerns.
customer_reviews.text: A pretty solid pad. Defiantly helps with the stability muscles. I use it at work at my standing desk all the time. Only issue is durrability. this pad is starting to get a lot of cracks in it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great device for strengthening balance
customer_reviews.text: Well made product, delivered on time. This board is very stable, isolating the movement to just side to side.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: You will be amazed with positive balance results
customer_reviews.text: I’m a physical therapist and use these with my geriatric patients to increase balance with amazing positive results. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Expense!
customer_reviews.text: After I used it successfully for PT with a professional, I bought my own to continue with the PT at home. I suffer from Plantar Fasciitis and this has helped my feet -- and just as importantly my balance!
customer_reviews.author: Garden Lover

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a home PT balance exercise. It is the same one used by my PT. For my money, it could be a little longer (toe to heel goes over the edge), but it does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: William G Couser

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great but after a year it's splitting in a pieces.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Great balance board!
customer_reviews.text: I use one just like this on physical therapy! Great to do my home exercises with. I like the insert that comes with additional exercises!
customer_reviews.author: teesee

customer_reviews.title: Balance Blue Pad
customer_reviews.text: I do home health and use this balance pad with my folks. I can be rather forgetful and leave it at that clients home. They keep it & don't let me know I left it! My lost so yea, I end up ordering another-hum!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Bumgarner

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Used this at a local Physical therapy clinic. Its great for building balance.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Twist

customer_reviews.title: VERY PLEASED WITH MY PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this brand because it was being used at the place where I was doing physical therapy to improve balance. It's easy to keep out of sight and I have been using it regularly in several positions. I also went on their site to learn different movements/positions and it's endless. I also picked this brand because when I looked at their reviews along with another brand which was less expensive, the positives were frequently mentioned. Now that I have completed my physical therapy, this is a great tool to continue retaining and improving my balance in my aging years where I was surprised to learn that we lose it too frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Geddes

customer_reviews.title: COMFORT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to stretches recommended by therapist. It was recommended to use a pillow or think blanket. I use this to place one knee and stretch out the other leg. Also, laying position and placing both feet to bring buttocks from floor. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Exactly like the one at my physical therapy office
customer_reviews.text: Well made and durable. Helps with weak ankle exercises and to increase balance, which I need as an older woman.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: recommend this to patients to purchase at my clinic, although pricey.
customer_reviews.text: The Airex is a really good tool for balance training. Especially for single leg balance and hip stability exercises in standing. I also use it if a patient needs a pad for kneeling, or on a chair to boost the height. A little expensive but it works well. I would buy more if the price was less.
customer_reviews.author: PhysioLakeville

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product! It's very comfortable to use. It has helped me a lot with musing it to do my knee exercises. It has a lot more uses to it, than I thought. It was a very good investment. I highly recommend this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size balance tool.
customer_reviews.text: Was purchased for vestibular therapy. It is the perfect size to store anywhere in a small apartment, but is still girthy enough to provide a challenge to the balance exercises. Would recomend.
customer_reviews.author: James Mccartney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I use this for hip thrusts as I got tired of rolling up my towel or using the bar pad - I highly recommend this for those of you who do hip thrusts - nothing is more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: R-burg

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Nice option for strengthening and balance. Recently had my knee scoped, and had a longer than expected road to recovery, due to high inflammation and lack of joint dexterity. I used something similar in PT, and this was a nice and affordable option to have at home for my workouts. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mail Debaser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stability trainer. I would recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Airex. I am a kiteboarder and when I recovered from knee injury I used it a couple of times a day for weeks and it helped a lot. Excellent stability training exercice also. More un expected: The kids love it too , so we keep on playong with it by challenge ourselves with a chrono in various potition on the pad. Very fun moments with kids guaranteed :-D
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just like they use in physical therapy to aid in gaining better balance to reduce falls. Also makes a comfortable pad to raise height of a low seated chair.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Foot Physiotherapy
customer_reviews.text: I initially used this at the physiotherapy office after a meniscus tear repair on my knee . I recently underwent a tibia tear replacement and wanted to continue my rehabilitation at home so ordered two to use on my sad foot and ankle. They are great for balance and strength and encouraging your toes to return to normal and not "grab". I use them every day in a variety of exercises and am pleased with my purchase. Recommended for anyone recovering from surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blue comfort heaven sent for aching backs
customer_reviews.text: I learned of these remarkable pads/cushions from my physical therapists, who said they were available through Amazon. They have made many aches and pains, especially of lower back, bearable and less painful for the up-and-downing of daily life. They fit into most easy chairs, wing chairs, Windsor type chairs, are lightweight and portable. I bought two and may buy two more. One of the greatest aids I've every known. ALAN N. HALL
customer_reviews.author: OBSERVANT READER/VIEWER

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time buying cheap foam pads.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great brand I tried to give another company a chance. This is one product do not skimp on. They are the king of foam pads. Last forever
customer_reviews.author: Chris Foote

customer_reviews.title: Top quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality in all respects. Wish it was an inch longer (big feet).
customer_reviews.author: Jasman

customer_reviews.title: Great for at home therapy
customer_reviews.text: I. Ought this because it is what my physical therapist uses. It is very helpful to be able to continue my therapy routine at home. Rather pricey but very helpful
customer_reviews.author: redamma

customer_reviews.title: I love my balance pad
customer_reviews.text: If it didn't cost so much, I'd purchase one for every room I walk into. I don't have specific issues with balance, but I do balance exercises every other day. Just standing on it in the morning is enough to stretch out my achilles tendon. I purchased it because I couldn't justify purchasing an even more-expensive (and dangerous) Bosu ball. I've had mine for over a year, using it daily, and it's held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Jude2004

customer_reviews.title: Great product, different color received
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, but I received the wrong color. I ordered the kiwi/green and received the pink...I'm actually happier with the color choice to be honest so it doesn't bother me at all, but just wanted to let others know the color may change that you order. It's worked great for me and I would order again!
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Interesting product - simple but effective
customer_reviews.text: Found out about airex balance pads via my gym. this is a pricey item, but something so simple and effective. Couch potatoes can purchase and when you are watching TV just practice standing on it for balance. Then stand on one foot for balance. lift weights while standing on the pad. Use it to do lunges. I gave one to my exercise buddy and she and her husband fight over sitting on it while watching TV. lol they also use to kneel on when giving their grand daughter a bath. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: CynS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent balance skill improvement device.
customer_reviews.text: The Airex Balance Pad is excellent tool for improving balance. It is likely a good idea to get some tips from a physical therapist as to the kinds of positioning and movements that will be useful to advance balance skills.
customer_reviews.author: WilNCope

customer_reviews.title: additional shapes/sizes availability
customer_reviews.text: Do you know if they make this in a round pad? Looking for it to use in a desk chair.
customer_reviews.author: Annette M Wade

customer_reviews.title: Firm but slightly giving...Perfect for balancing.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent firm, but slightly giving pad for balance exercises, etc. Not rock hard like some but with just enough give.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Balance relief
customer_reviews.text: I was first introduced to this while at doing physical therapy. I asked the therapist what it was called and immediately ordered it! It has really helped my balance in a way that I can't do on my own....
customer_reviews.author: smc

customer_reviews.title: Really well made.
customer_reviews.text: This pad is really well made. Thicker than most. I have trouble with my knees on most pads, but no trouble with my knees on this one. It's a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Interested Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Airex is a great product for helping with knee rehab and was recommended ...
customer_reviews.text: Airex is a great product for helping with knee rehab and was recommended by my physical therapist. There was a big poster with a lot of different exercises too. I really like it and use it 3x a week.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Dearman

customer_reviews.title: Great balance and workout product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to my fitness routine, and I use it every day to work on my balance. It is helping to strengthen my ankles, helping me to walk better in high heels. I also sit on it to do abs, I like that it is very firm phone and works extremely well. Also included is a chart with exercises
customer_reviews.author: 3timesalady

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it has great potential
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this much, but I think it has pretty awesome potential. I bought it to help my mom with balance, but there are so many possibilities, I'll probably keep it for myself and get another for her. The best part are all of the programs available for free on the Airex website that go well beyond balance. I'm glad I chose the version with the texture for a little more traction.
customer_reviews.author: Janice M.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this after having bought a more expensive one for my daughter. The quality is just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Boppy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely helps with balance!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Balance Pad after a doctor loaned me one to help with balance issues. It has enough "give," but it's not flimsy--it's more like a firm/medium weight foam sofa cushion. I read reviews for other-brand pads and they are of flimsy construction. If you have mild balance issues, those would be fine, but if you have medium-severe balance issues, then this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret E. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Quality Balance Pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY nice balance pad -- I'd recommend also checking out the Yes4All Balance Pad (which is nearly identical at a fraction of the price). They're both quality product and you cannot go wrong with either.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Product recommended by Home Care Physical therapist, it is the same one they use.
customer_reviews.author: Merle

customer_reviews.title: Just the pad for me
customer_reviews.text: After having a gait problem for a couple of weeks, I tried this pad. I loved the way that standing on it makes you notice the muscles in your legs and feet as you are getting your balance, I really don't use it for any kind of exercise therapy, but I like to stand on it for a few minutes gazing out the window. I am eldery and feel that this is a nice test, just to see how I'm doing in the balance department. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Randall

customer_reviews.title: MANY USES
customer_reviews.text: We bought the pad to use in our home gym primarily for glute bridging & hip thrusting but it also comes in handy for plank work as well. However, while putting a tile floor in an upstairs bath one weekend recently, it was a wonderful surprise to find that it also doubles as a great knee pad too. LIFE (or should I say ) KNEE SAVER!! Great product and seems to very durable ( still very new). Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M Hendy

product_meta.title: Airex Balance Pads - Official Airex Pad for Physical Therapy, Rehabilitation, Balance & Stability Exercises - Available in Multiple Colors & Sizes
feature_bullets: Super-soft specialty foam is suitable for training and restoring motor skills and balance
Balance pad combines both exercise and balance skills to increase strength, stamina, and coordination
Pad will not absorb water and is pre-sanitized
